1100436663598235648.text: 6/ This dynamic should be a huge news story right now, but it's too nuanced for the popular narrative to digest. Fin.

1100434921649246208.text: 5/ Pundits have talked of the "splinternet" - a balkanization of the internet between the US and China. I believe a more likely - and scary - future is a "splatternet" - a global splattering of Chinese technological power all across the world, including right here in America.

1100434485391384576.text: 4/ While China is blocked to western technology companies not willing to play by its rules, Chinese and China-affiliated software players are quietly growing market share in the western world (and accumulating a huge volume of data in the process).

1100433791598952448.text: 3/ In related news, one of the largest shareholders in Fortnite is Tencent.

1100433123236560898.text: 2/ TikTok is extraordinarily popular amongst US teens and growing extremely fast. It may be a fad, it may endure. Regardless, given China’s philosophy on privacy perhaps some attention should be paid to its rise by privacy advocates outraged at FB.

979011634617356288.text: Whenever an easily understood and easy to replicate new startup shows even a glimmer of promise, the hallucinations kick in, narrative mirages form, and clone wars are born seemingly overnight.http://Bedrockcap.com/letter

978799761577992193.text: We forget that narratives are not synonymous with truth. They can reflect what people wish were true, what would make people rich if they were true, or simply what an algorithm spits out as truly profitable.http://Bedrockcap.com/letter

978762960561758208.text: Deeply considering — and defending — the societal consequences of a product is now as elemental to building a startup as was writing a line of code. Not for the faint of heart.http://Bedrockcap.com/letter

978713744745422848.text: The selfishness is mutual -- Miss you and my friends on the @foundersfund team a lot day to day! Thanks for the kind words.https://twitter.com/micsolana/status/978710249254236160 …

978689849938120704.text: The best moment in time to invest in a company is when it is most in violation of a popular narrative. http://www.bedrockcap.com/letter pic.twitter.com/DCEWCwcFMk

978676652849991680.text: 8/ Against all odds, a few brave entrepreneurs violating the narrative today will come to define profound new truths tomorrow. @bedrockcap, we’re on a mission to find them.https://techcrunch.com/2018/03/27/bedrock-capital/ …

978676488865271808.text: 7/ When we allow popular narrative to dictate who, where, and what is worthy of our time or capital, breakthroughs that could transcend remain overlooked, underestimated, or simply fade away.

978676408569524224.text: 6/ As our keystrokes hunt for the next narrative high, thousands of possibilities that will never be remain trapped beneath our fingertips.

978676328579915776.text: 5/ In a Shakespearean twist, Silicon Valley’s success has narratively ensnared it on two levels. Not only has the popular narrative turned against the tech industry, but many in the industry themselves are caught in a narrative thrall that’s supplanting independent thought.

978676238771544067.text: 4/ We’ve become addicted to consuming the narrative; it’s dopamine hits are delivered by the decisecond on every screen — whether via Twitter, CoinMarketCap, or everything in between.

978676103605899264.text: 3/ Yet when the pendulum swings too far, narratives become a shortcut for thinking and we shortchange our future.

978675987071238150.text: 2/ Narratives can inspire us. They can move us to stand for something. They can make us feel connected to others. All of these are important, especially today

978675870851325952.text: 1/ Introducing Bedrock: A venture capital firm in search of narrative violationshttp://www.bedrockcap.com/letter
